seriesStmt.title: SPEAR: Syriac Persons, Events, and Relations

listBibl.head: Sources for the Data in this Born Digital Prosopography

bibl.title: The Chronicle of Edessa
The Journal of Sacred Literature, New Series [=Series 4]

category.catDesc: Used to denote a date calculated by the editor from a regnal year or some other dating method given in the text.

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: Add a human readable version or the tei:relation element in a tei:desc.

relation.desc: Abgar VIII was the child of Maʿnu.

event.desc: In November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 during the reign of Abgar the Great , the Daisan river flooded Edessa destroying the western wall of the city, the Great Palace , and the Church of the Christians .

personGrp.persName: Workers in the government of Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513

occupation.note: Anonymi 2210 were government officials in Edessa .

personGrp.persName: The wise men of Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513

event.desc: In November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 , Abgar commanded the removal of the flood gates of Edessa .

personGrp.persName: The two thousand people killed by flooding in Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 .

event.desc: Two thousand people were killed in Edessa by the flooding of the Daisan river in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-18, 8559-545.

personGrp.persName: The craftsmen of Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 .

event.desc: In November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 , Abgar commanded the craftsmen of Edessa to remove their cottage from the banks of the Daisan river .

personGrp.persName: The measurers and men of skill of Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 .

occupation.note: Anonymi 2230 were skilled laborers in Edessa .

personGrp.persName: Those who lived in the portico in Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513
The islanders of Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 .

occupation.note: The islanders were watchmen in Edessa .

event.desc: In November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 , Abgar commanded those who live in the portico of Edessa not to lodge in their cottages during the winter.
After November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 , Abgar commanded to be built a royal house in Beth Tabara where he dwelt during the winters.

personGrp.persName: The nobles of Abgar of Edessa in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 .

socecStatus.note: Anonymi 2233 were the nobles of Abgar in Edessa .

event.desc: After November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 , Abgar remitted the taxes of Edessa and the surrounding towns for five years on account of the flood.

occupation.note: Mar Yahab Bar Shemesh was a scribe of Edessa .
Kaiuma Bar Magartat was a scribe of Edessa .

relation.desc: Yahab bar Shemesh and Qayuma bar Magartat had a professional relationship.

occupation.note: Bar Din was a prefect over the archives of Edessa .
Bulid was prefect over the archives of Edessa .

relation.desc: Bar Din and Bulid had a professional relationship.

event.desc: After November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 , Mar Yahab Bar Shemesh and Kaiuma Bar Magartat recorded the flooding of Edessa.
After November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513 , Bar Din and Bulid archived the record of the flooding of Edessa .
In 132/1 B.C. A. Gr. 180 Kings began to rule in Edessa .

occupation.note: Augustus Caesar was king of Rome .

event.desc:
In 44 B.C.
46/5 B.C. A. Gr. 266
Augustus became King of Rome .

ab.note: The author has apparently mistaken the date of Augustus' accession.

event.desc: Jesus was born in 3/2 B.C. A. Gr. 309
Abgar built a mausoleum for himself in 88/9 A. Gr. 400 .
Marcion forsook the catholic church in 137/8 A. Gr. 449 .
Bardaisan was born on 11 July 154 11 Tammuz A. Gr. 465

relation.desc: Lucius Verus and Commodus were siblings.

personGrp.persName: The Parthians conquered by Lucius Verus in 165/6\ This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the fifth year of Lucius's reign

event.desc: Lucius Verus and his brother Commodus conquered the Parthians in 165/6This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the fifth year of Lucius's reign .
In 205/6 A. Gr. 517 Abgar built a new palace in Edessa
Mani was born in 239/40 A. Gr. 551 .
The walls of Edessa were destroyed in 302/3 A. Gr. 614 .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-79, 8559-546.

event.desc: Qunā laid the foundations of the Church of Edessa in 312/3 A. Gr. 624 .
After 312/3 A. Gr. 624 , Shaʿad finished building the Church of Edessa .
The cemetery of Edessa was built in 323/4 A. Gr. 635 .
Aitalaha became Bishop of Edessa in 324/5 A. Gr. 636 .

ab.note:
The text seems to be confused regarding the relative dates of several events in this section.
94-95

event.desc: Aitalaha built the cemetery and the eastern side of the Church of Edessa in 324/5 A. Gr. 636 .

ab.note:
The text seems to be confused regarding the relative dates of several events in this section.
94-95

event.desc: In 325 A. Gr. 636 a Council of 318 bishops met at Nicaea .

ab.note:
The text seems to be confused regarding the relative dates of several events in this section.
94-95

event.desc: In 327/8 A. Gr. 639 the Church of Edessa was enlarged.

person.persName: Mar Yaʿqub the bishop of Nisibis
Mar Jacob the Bishop of Nisibis

event.desc: Jacob of Nisibis died in 337/8 A. Gr. 649 .
In 345/6 A. Gr. 657 Abraham became Bishop of Edessa .
In 345/6 A. Gr. 657 Abraham built the House of the Confessors in Edessa .

relation.desc: Constantius II was the child of Constantine the Great.

event.desc: In 348/9 A. Gr. 660 Constantius built the city of Amida .
In 349/50 A. Gr. 661 Constantius rebuilt the city of Tella .
In 355/6 A. Gr. 667 Abraham Qidūnāyā became a hermit.
In 355/6 A. Gr. 667 Abraham Qidūnāyā became Bishop of Edessa .

ab.note:
This event information is based on B. Cowper's poor translation of the text.
97

event.desc: Abraham died in 360/1 A. Gr. 672 .
Vologesh died in 360/1 A. Gr. 672 .

relation.desc: Barsa and Constantius II had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 360/1 A. Gr. 672 the Emperor Constantius translated Bishop Barsā from Harran to Edessa .
In 358/9 A. Gr. 670 Nicomedia was overthrown.
In June 363 Ḥazirān A. Gr. 674 Julian made war against Persia .
Julian died in June 363 Ḥazirān A. Gr. 674 .

relation.desc: Valentinian I and Valens were siblings.

event.desc: In February A. D. 364 Shebāṭ A. Gr. 675 Valentinian became King of Rome .
In March 364 February A. D. 364 Shebāṭ A. Gr. 675 Valens became King of Rome .

ab.note: The author mistakenly asserts that Valens became emperor the same month as Valentinian.

event.desc: Julian Saba died in 366/7 A. Gr. 678 .
In 369/70 A. Gr. 681 the great House of Baptism of Edessa was built.
Ephrem died on 9 June 373 9 Ḥazirān A. Gr. 684 .

personGrp.persName: The people of Edessa who fled the persecution of the Arians in September A. D. 373 Elul A. Gr. 684
The Arians who persecuted people in the Church of Edessa in September A. D. 373 Elul A. Gr. 684 .

relation.desc: Anonymi 2211 had enmity for Anonymi 2208.

event.desc: In September A. D. 373 Elul A. Gr. 684 people fled the Church of Edessa because of the persecution of Arians .
Barsā died in March 378 Ādar A. Gr. 689

personGrp.persName: The orthodox who returned to the city of Edessa in December A. D.377 Kānun I A. Gr. 689 after being persecuted by the Arians

event.desc: In December A. D.377 Kānun I A. Gr. 689 The orthodox recovered the Church of Edessa .

occupation.note: Mar Eulogios was Bishop of Edessa .

event.desc: In 379/80This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the year Theodosius the Great became king Mar Eulogios became Bishop of Edessa .

occupation.note: Theodosius the Great was Emperor of Rome .

event.desc: After 379/80 the year Theodosius the Great became king Eulogios built the House of Mar Daniel which was called the House of Mar Demet .
In 380/1 A. Gr. 692 Theodosius the Great built Reshʿayna in Osrhoene .

personGrp.persName: Those attending the Council of Constantinople in 381 381/2 A. Gr. 693

ab.note: The author dates the Council of Constantinople in A. Gr. 693. Since it took place in the spring of 381, it should be dated to A. Gr. 692.

event.desc: In 381 381/2 A. Gr. 693 attendants gathered for a Council of 150 bishops in Constantinople .

ab.note: The author date the Council of Constantinople in A. Gr. 693. Since it took place in the spring of 381, it should be dated to A. Gr. 692.

event.desc: On 23 April A. D. 387 Good Friday, A. Gr. 698 Eulogios died.
On 22 August A. D. 394 22 Tammuz A. Gr. 705 the coffin of Mar Thomas the Apostle was brought to his great temple .
On 17 January A. D. 395 17 Kānun II A. Gr. 706 Theodosius died.
On 27 April A. D. 395 27 Nisān A. Gr. 706 Arcadius entered Constantinople .

On 8 November A. D. 395
8 November A. D. 394 8 Teshri II A. Gr. 706
the body of Theodosius entered Constantinople .

personGrp.persName: The Huns who entered Roman territory in July, 395 Tammuz A. Gr. 706

event.desc: In July, 395 Tammuz A. Gr. 706 the Huns entered Roman territory .
In July 396 Tammuz A. Gr. 707 Mar Cyrus died.

occupation.note: Mar Silwanā was Bishop of Edessa .

event.desc: In 396/7 A. Gr. 708 Mar Silwanā became Bishop of Edessa .

person.persName: Mar Silwanā the Bishop of Edessa .
Mar Silvanus the Bishop of Edessa .

event.desc: In 17 October A. D. 398 17 Teshri I A. Gr. 710 Mar Silwanā died.

occupation.note: Mar Pakidā was Bishop of Edessa .

event.desc: On 23 November A. D. 398 23 Teshri II A. Gr. 710 Mar Pakidā became Bishop of Edessa .

occupation.note: John Chrysostom was Bishop of Constantinople .

event.desc: In 398/9 A. Gr. 710 John Chrysostom became Bishop of Constantinople .
In 402/3 A. Gr. 714 Theodore of Mopsuestia . began to expound the scriptures.

occupation.note: ʿAbsmayyā was a priest in Edessa .

person.persName: The sister of the blessed Mar Ephrem

relation.desc: Anonmyous 2234 and Ephrem were siblings.
ʿAbshmayya was the child of Anonmyous 2234.
ʿAbshmayya was the child of a sibling of Ephrem.

event.desc: In 403/4 A. Gr. 715 ʿAbsmayyā composed madrāshe on the Huns entering Roman territory .

occupation.note: Mar Diogenis was Bishop of Edessa .

event.desc: In 403/4 A. Gr. 720 Mar Diogenis became Bishop of Edessa .
In 403/4 A. Gr. 720 Mar Diogenis began to build the House of Mar Barlāhā .
On 1 August A. D. 409 1 Āb A. Gr. 720 Mar Pakidā died.
In 409/10 A. Gr. 721 Cyril became Bishop of Alexandria .
In 411/2 A. Gr. 723 Rabbula became Bishop of Edessa .
In 411/2 A. Gr. 723 Rabbula built in Edessa the House of Mar Stephanos previously called the House of the Sabbath of the Jews of Edessa by the command of Theodosius .
In 412/3 A. Gr. 724 the walls of Edessa were broken down by a flood for the third time.

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-261, 8559-554.
Arcadius and Honorios had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 420/1 A. Gr. 732 Eutyches became a monk.
In 420/1 A. Gr. 732 Jacob the Mutilated suffered martyrdom.

death.note: Jacob the Mutilated suffered martyrdom in 420/1.

event.desc: In 427/8 A. Gr. 739 the heresy of those who say that sin is implanted in nature became known.
In 428/9 A. Gr. 740 Andreos became Bishop of Samosata .
In 429/30 A. Gr. 741 dust came down from heaven.

In 431
A. Gr. 742 the first Council of Ephesus was assembled.
On 8 August A. D. 435 8 Āb A. Gr. 746 Rabbula died.
After 8 August A. D. 435 8 Āb A. Gr. 746 Hiba became Bishop of Edessa .
After 8 August A. D. 435 8 Āb A. Gr. 746 Hiba built the new church which came to be called the House of the Apostles .

ab.note: Theodoret's Letters 44 and 93 are addressed to Senator, a Patrician.

event.desc: In 437/8 A. Gr. 749 Senator bought a silver table weighing 720 pounds and it was placed in the old Church of Edessa .
In 441/2 A. Gr. 753 Anatolius made a coffin of silver in honor of the bones of Thomas the Apostle
In 444/5 A. Gr. 756 Dioscorus became Bishop of Alexandria

personGrp.persName: The bishops assembled at the Second Council of Ephesus in A. D. 429

relation.passive: http://syriaca.org/person/2282 http://syriaca.org/person/2264 http://syriaca.org/person/847 http://syriaca.org/person/534 http://syriaca.org/person/2280 http://syriaca.org/person/2257 http://syriaca.org/person/2304 http://syriaca.org/person/781
relation.desc: Anonymi 2314 had enmity for Flavian, Domnus of Antioch, Irenaeus of Tyre, Hiba of Edessa, Eusebius of Dorylaeum, Daniel of Harran, Silwana and Theodoret of Cyrrhus.

event.desc: The bishops assembled at the Second Council of Ephesus anathematized Flavian of Constantinople , Domnus of Antioch , Irenaeus of Tyre , Hiba of Edessa , Eusebius of Dorylaeum , Daniel of Ḥarran , Sophronius of Tella , and Theodoret of Cyrrhus .
On 1 January A. D. 448 1 Kānun II A. Gr. 759 Hiba left Edessa .

ab.note:
The dates of Hiba's exile from Edessa and reinstatement are confused here.
116-17

event.desc: On 21 July 448 21 Tāmmuz A. Gr. 759 Nonos became Bishop of Edessa .

ab.note:
The dates of Hiba's exile and Nonos' first episcopate are confused here.
116-17

event.desc: After 21 July 448 21 Tāmmuz A. Gr. 759 Nonos built a sacristy in the Church of Edessa .

ab.note:
The dates of Hiba's exile and Nonos' first episcopate are confused here.
116-17

event.desc: In 448/9 A. Gr. 760 Leo became Bishop of Rome .

ab.note: Leo I became Pope on 29 September 440.

event.desc: In October 451 450/51 A. Gr. 762 a council was assembled in the city of Chalcedon .

ab.note:
Since the first session of the Council of Chalcedon began on 8 October (Teshri I) of 451, the correct year A. Gr. would be 763, not 762.
113

event.desc: On 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Hiba died.
After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos became Bishop of Edessa .

trait.note: Mar Yōḥanān the baptist was male.

event.desc: After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos built the House of John the Baptist in Edessa .
After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos built the House for the leperous poor of Edessa outside the gate of Beth Shemesh .
After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos built the House of Martyrs to Mar Cosmas and Mar Damian .
After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos built monasteries.
After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos built towers.
After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos built bridges.
After 28 October A. D. 457 28 Teshri I A. Gr. 769 Nonos made the roads secure.

death.note: Simeon the Stylite died on 28 October 460.

ab.note: The correct date for the death of Simeon the Stylite is A. Gr. 770 (459), not A. Gr. 771.

event.desc: On Wednesday 28 October A. D. 459 Wednesday 28 October A. D. 460 Wednesday 2 Elul A. Gr. 771 at the eleventh hour Simeon the Stylite died.

ab.note: The correct date for the death of Simeon the Stylite is A. Gr. 770 (459), not A. Gr. 771.

event.desc: In 465/6 A. Gr. 777 Leo built Kallinikos in Osrhoene and called it Leontopolis .
In 465/6 A. Gr. 777 , Leo established a Bishop of Kallinikos .
In 470/1 A. Gr. 782 Nonos died.
In 470/1 A. Gr. 782 Cyrus became Bishop of Edessa .

occupation.note: Leontios was a usurper of the imperial throne.

relation.desc: Leontios and Zeno had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 483/4 A. Gr. 795 Leontios rebelled against Zeno and reigned for two years in Antioch .

personGrp.persName: The participants in the School of the Persians who were removed from Edessa in 488/9 A. Gr. 800

event.desc: In 488/9 A. Gr. 800 The School of the Persians was removed from Edessa .

personGrp.persName: The craftsmen of the land around Edessa in May 498 Iyār A. Gr. 809

event.desc: In May 498 tIyār A. Gr. 809 the trade tax was remitted for the craftsmen of the land .
On 6 June 498 6 Ḥazirān A. Gr. 809 Cyrus died.
Peter became bishop and entered the city of Edessa on 12 September 498 12 Elul A. Gr. 809 .

personGrp.persName: The inhabitants of Nicopolis killed in the earthquake of 498/9 A. Gr. 810

event.desc: In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 many locusts appeared in Edessa and did little damage but layed eggs.
In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 there was a great earthquake.
In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 the hotspring of Abarne stopped for three days.

ab.note:
Hallier proposes the reconstruction of the text used here.
119, 152

event.desc: In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 the city of Nicopolis was destroyed by an earthquake .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-388, 8559-389, 8559-396

event.desc:
In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 the inhabitants of Nicopolis
died in an earthquake.

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-311, 8559-389, 8559-396

occupation.note: Anonymous 2235 was the Bishop of Nicopolis .

personGrp.persName: Two synkelli in Nicopolis at the time of the earthquake in 498/9 A. Gr. 810

relation.desc: Anonymous 2235 had ecclesiastical authority over Anonymi 2218.

event.desc: In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 the Bishop of Nicopolis . and two synkelli survived an earthquake that destroyed Nicopolis .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-388, 8559-389, 8559-396

event.desc: In January 499 Kānun II A. Gr. 810 a sign like a spear appeared for many days in the sky above Edessa .

relation.desc: Anastasios I and Euphemios had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 Anastasios deposed Euphemius .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-408, 8559-409

event.desc: In 498/9 A. Gr. 810 Macedon became Bishop of Constantinople after the deposition of Euphemius .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-408, 8559-409

event.desc: In 499/500 A. Gr. 811 locusts devoured the grain of Edessa .
On 22 August A. D. 502 22 Āb A. Gr. 813 a great fire appeared in the north of the city of Edessa .
Kavad besieged the city of Amida from 5 November A. D. 502 to 10 February 503 for 97 days beginning on 5 Teshri II A. Gr. 814
On 10 February A. D. 503 the 97th day after 5 Teshri II A. Gr. 814 Kavad captured the city of Amida .
In September A. D. 503 Elul A. Gr. 814 Kavad besieged Edessa but did not capture it.

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-420, 8559-421

event.desc: During the seige of Edessa in September A. D. 503 Elul A. Gr. 814 Kavad burned the House of Mar Sergius and the House of the Confessors .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-420, 8559-421

orig.date: The Sabbath of the Resurrection A. Gr. 821

event.desc: On 10 April A. D. 510 the Sabbath of the Resurrection A. Gr. 821 Peter died.
After 10 April A. D. 510 the Sabbath of the Resurrection A. Gr. 821 Pawlā became Bishop of Edessa .

In 511/2This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the 21st year of the reign of Anastasios Anastasios commanded them to open the coffin of Euphemia the martyr , remove the book placed there by the Council of Chalcedon , and burn it. Anastasios relented when fire from heaven struck the faces of those wishing to remove it .

personGrp.persName: Those struck by fire in 511/2This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the 21st year of the reign of Anastasios because they wanted to remove the book placed in the coffin of Euphemia the martyr by the Council of Chalcedon .

relation.desc: Anastasios I and Macedonios II had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 511/2This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the 21st year of the reign of Anastasios Anastasios deposed Macedon because he did not anathematize the Council of Chalcedon .

In 511/2This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the 21st year of the reign of Anastasios Timotheos became Bishop of Constantinople .

relation.desc: Vitalian and Anastasios I had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 511/2This regularized date was calculated by the SPEAR editor from a non-calendrical dating system such as regnal years, etc. the 24st year of the reign of Anastasios Vitalian rebelled against Anastasios .
On 9 July 518 9 Tammuz A. Gr. 829 Anastasios died.
After 9 July 518 9 Tammuz A. Gr. 829 Justin became King of Rome .

relation.desc: Justin I, Severus of Antioch and Philoxenos of Mabbug had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 518/19 A. Gr. 830 Justin deposed Severus and Philoxenos for refusing to accept the Council of Chalcedon .

relation.desc: Patricius, Justin I and Pawla had a professional relationship.

event.desc: On 4 November A. D. 519 4 Teshri II A. Gr. 831 Patricius arrived in Edessa at the command of the Emperor Justin in order to urge Bishop Pawlā to receive the Council of Chalcedon or else be deposed.

After 4 November A. D. 519 4 Teshri II A. Gr. 831 , Bishop Pawlā refused to accept the Council of Chalcedon . When Patricius threatened to remove him from Edessa he fled to the House of Baptism . Fearing the command of Emperor Justin , Patricius removed Bishop Pawlā to Seleucia .
In 520/1 A. Gr. 832 , the Emperor Justin returned Bishop Pawlā to his episcopal see in Edessa hoping that he would accept the Council of Chalcedon .
Pawlā refused to accept the Council of Chalcedon and on 27 July 27 A. D. 522 27 Tammuz A. Gr. 833 Emperor Justin deposed him and exiled him to Euchata .
Asclepius became bishop and entered the city of Edessa on 23 October A. D. 522 23 Teshri I A. Gr. 834 .

personGrp.persName: The monks of the east in 24 December A. D. 522 24 Kānun I A. Gr. 834

relation.desc: Asclepius had ecclesiastical authority over Anonymi 2221.

event.desc: In 24 December A. D. 522 24 Kānun I A. Gr. 834 Bishop Asclepius drove off the monks of the east because they would not accept the Council of Chalcedon .
In 524/5 A. Gr. 836 a flood destroyed Edessa for the fourth time.

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-476, 8559-555.
Asclepius and Euphrasios had a professional relationship.

event.desc: In 424/5 A. Gr. 836 , after the flooding of Edessa Asclepius fled Edessa and spent 70 days in Antioch with Euphrasius .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-476, 8559-482

event.desc: Asclepius died in Antioch on 27 June 525 27 Ḥazirān A. Gr. 836 .
On 4 September A. D. 525 4 Elul A. Gr. 836 they moved the body of Asclepius from Antioch to Edessa where he was buried alongside Nonos in the the House of Mar Barlāhā .

relation.desc: Justinian I, Euphrasios and Pawla had a professional relationship.

event.desc: After 27 June 525 27 Ḥazirān A. Gr. 836 , Pawlā repented of his opposition to the Council of Chalcedon , petitioned Justinian for the return of his episcopal see, and wrote a libellus affirming the council to Euphrasius the Patriarch .

Following Pawlā's acceptance of the Council of Chalcedon and a letter of support from Justinian , the Emperor Justin restored Pawlā to his episcopal see and he entered Edessa on 8 March 526 8 Ādar A. Gr. 837 .
On 30 October A. D. 526 30 Teshri I A. Gr. 838 Pawlā died.
Andreos became bishop and entered the city of Edessa on 7 February A. D. 527 7 Shebāṭ A. Gr. 838 .
Justinian put into the diptychs of the church the four holy synods: the Council of Nicaea , the Council of Constantinople , the Council of Ephesus , and the Council of Chalcedon .
On 5 October A. D. 538 5 Teshri I A. Gr. 850 a sign like a spear appeared in the sky above Edessa .
On 29 May 526 29 Iyār A. Gr. 837 at the seventh hour a great earthquake struck Antioch .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-501, 8559-502

event.desc: On 15 November A. D. 527 15 Teshri II A. Gr. 839 a great fire of unknown origin burned much of what remained of Antioch after it was destroyed by earthquake .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-501, 8559-502

event.desc: On 29 May 526 29 Iyār A. Gr. 837 Euphrasius the Patriarch of Antioch died in an earthquake.

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-501, 8559-504

occupation.note: Ephrem of Amida was Comes of the East .
Ephrem of Amida was Patriarch of Antioch .

event.desc: After 29 May 526 29 Iyār A. Gr. 8371 Ephrem of Amida became Patriarch of Antioch .
In December A. D. 532 Kānun I A. Gr. 844 Andreos died and was buried in the the House of Mar Barlāhā alongside the bones of Mar Nonos and Mar Asclepius
Addai became bishop and entered the city of Edessa on 28 August A. D. 533 28 Āb A. Gr. 844 .
On 1 April 527 1 Nisān A. Gr. 838 Justinian became Caesar.

relation.desc: Justinian I and Justin I had a professional relationship.

event.desc: On 10 August A. D. 527 10 Āb A. Gr. 838 Justinian became the sole King of Rome .
On 10 August A. D. 527 10 Āb A. Gr. 838 Justin died.

personGrp.persName: The Roman army commanded by Demosthenes in July 531 Tammuz A. Gr. 842

event.desc: In July 531 Tammuz A. Gr. 842 Demosthenes arrived in Edessa to command the Roman army .

personGrp.persName: The Huns who entered Roman territory on 18 December A. D. 531 18 Kānun I A. Gr. 843

event.desc: On 18 December A. D. 531 18 Kānun I A. Gr. 843 the Huns entered Roman territory and plundered as far as the area around Aleppo and Antioch .
On 10 January A. D. 532 10 Kānun II A. Gr. 843 Demosthenes fell sick and died in Tella while fighting the Huns .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-531, 8559-533

event.desc: In September A. D. 532 Elul A. Gr. 843 Rufinus made peace between Rome , and Persia .
There was peace between Rome and Persia from September 532 to May 540 Elul A. Gr. 843 to Iyār A. Gr. 851

person.persName: Chosroes the King of the Persians

event.desc: In May 540 Iyār A. Gr. 851 Chosroes broke the peace and invaded Roman territory . He laid waste Shura , Aleppo , and Antioch .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with closely related events: 8559-538, 8559-542

personGrp.persName: The great men of the city of Edessa in May 540 Iyār A. Gr. 851

event.desc: After May 540 Iyār A. Gr. 851 , the great men of the city of Edessa saved the city from Chosroes by paying him two centenaria of gold, after which Chosroes returned to Persia .
The first time the walls of Edessa were broken down was in November A. D. 201 Teshri II A. Gr. 513

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-18, 8559-545.

event.desc: The second time the walls of Edessa were broken down . was in the days of Diocletian the King in May 303 Iyār A. Gr. 614

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-79 and 8559-546.
Honorios and Theodosius II had a professional relationship.

event.desc: The third time the walls of Edessa were broken down was in the days of the Kings Honorios and Theodosius and of the bishop Rabbula in March 413 Ādar A. Gr. 724 .

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-261, 8559-554.

event.desc: The fourth time the walls of Edessa were broken down was in the days of the king Justin and of the bishop Asclepius in 424/5 A. Gr. 836

relation.desc: The following factoids deal with the same event: 8559-476, 8559-555.

bibl.title: The Chronicle of Edessa

Untersuchungen über die Edessenische Chronik. Texte und Untersuchungen zur Geschichte der altchristlichen Literatur 9.1
bibl.author: Ludwig Hallier

bibl.title: Stewards of the Poor: The Man of God, Rabbula, and Hiba in Fifth-Century Edessa
